availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Wallace Jr. (Green County, Kentucky, farmhand.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmhand. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Wallace, Sr., and Martha Wallace. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal and sergeant from December 30, 1861 to September 15, 1862. Reported as deserted on September 15,1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 92A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, pp. 603-4.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0269.
